remarks.para: One valve (affecting two wheels) may be inoperative provided:

numlitem.para: Both of the associated brakes are deactivated by capping the supply pressure hydraulic line, and
AOM/AA Data performance decrements are applied.

note.para: The following EICAS message(s) may be displayed:

numlitem.para: Stopping distances will increase.
Leave gear down for a minimum of 2 minutes after takeoff to permit affected wheel(s) to spin down prior to gear retraction.
Observe performance limitations.
Maximum takeoff thrust must be used.

note.para: At takeoff weights greater than 720,000 lbs., flaps up maneuver speed (VREF + 100 kt) may exceed the landing gear retract speed (270 kt). Therefore, ensure gear is retracted prior to selecting Flaps Up.

numlitem.para: Downgrade Aircraft Category Dispatch Status to CAT 3a.
Compute V1 using the V1 correction, One or Two Brakes Deactivated or One or Two Anti-Skid Channels Inoperative worksheet in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
Apply takeoff performance runway weight corrections from the Takeoff Runway Limit Weight Reduction, Landing Gear Extended or Brake(s) Deactivated By Capping chart found in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
Apply restricted takeoff climb weights from the Takeoff Climb Limit Weight, Landing Gear Extended or Brake(s) Deactivated By Capping chart found in the AOM Chapter 5.1.
Apply landing weight performance for 1 or 2 brakes deactivated in the AA landing data.
If "Obstacle Clearance Altitude (OCA)" is present on the AA Data for the departure runway, contact Flight Control for alternate AA Data.
Operations on cluttered or icy runways prohibited.
Use cutback runway is prohibited.

placard.para: Install Placards as directed in DMP procedure. Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.
Placard Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel: "WHEEL_ BRAKE(S) DEACTIVATED WITH LINES CAPPED". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.
Cap and deactivate the associated brake lines and prior to every flight review CMC messages when ANTISKID advisory message is displayed.

numlitem.para: Deactivate the associated brakes using DMP 32-41-1-2.
For ANTISKID advisory message displayed, before each flight review CMC for additional antiskid faults.

note.para: The ground set-up procedure may be simplified. The IRUs do not need to be in NAV mode. (Ignore any IRS signal fault indications). Hydraulic pressure is not required. Autobrake system does not need to be armed.

numlitem.para: Select 32 BRAKE CONTROL from the CMC GROUND TEST menu.
Execute the BRAKE SYSTEM BITE test. Record all antiskid system configuration and input faults annunciated during the test.

Following the conclusion of the CMC Brake System Ground Test, select the line-select key opposite the FAIL prompt on the CMC and record the antiskid system fault. Continue to select the NEXT PAGE key on the CMC as required and record the antiskid system faults.

note.para: When CMC message PARK BRK VLV NOT OPEN WHEN RELEASED or NO PARK BRKE PWR is displayed, dispatch is not allowed (Brake Torque Limiter is inoperative). This condition causes Status message PARK BRK VALVE as well as ANTISKID OFF and BRAKE LIMITER Advisory messages.

numlitem.para: For additional faults indicated, use DMP item 32-42-1-0-1, 32-42-1-1, 32-42-1-1-1, or 32-42-1-2 as applicable.
